situation: B became visibly distressed during a group presentation, unable to follow her peers due to the classroom noise affecting her concentration.
action: The TA facilitated a quiet zone with headphones that reduced ambient noise and worked with B to reinforce concepts through visual aids. She reassured B and helped her prepare for the presentation by pre-teaching vocabulary and context used in class discussion.
effect: The intervention enabled B to follow the class activities better and participate with increased confidence. Having a tailored approach improved her understanding and reduced the stress of participating in group settings.
